post.description: Create a new link for the authenticated workspace.

url.description: The destination URL of the short link.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `pim.ms` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

externalId.description: The ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in future API requests (must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter). This key is unique across your workspace.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant that created the link inside your system. If set, it can be used to fetch all links for a tenant.

programId.description: The ID of the program the short link is associated with.

partnerId.description: The ID of the partner the short link is associated with.

prefix.description: The prefix of the short link slug for randomly-generated keys (e.g. if prefix is `/c/`, generated keys will be in the `/c/:key` format). Will be ignored if `key` is provided.

trackConversion.description: Whether to track conversions for the short link. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

archived.description: Whether the short link is archived. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

publicStats.description: Deprecated: Use `dashboard` instead. Whether the short link's stats are publicly accessible. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

tagId.description: The unique ID of the tag assigned to the short link. This field is deprecated – use `tagIds` instead.

tagIds.description: The unique IDs of the tags assigned to the short link.

tagNames.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

folderId.description: The unique ID existing folder to assign the short link to.

comments.description: The comments for the short link.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the short link will expire at.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when the short link has expired.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

proxy.description: Whether the short link uses Custom Social Media Cards feature. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

title.description: The custom link preview title (og:title). Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

description.description: The custom link preview description (og:description). Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

image.description: The custom link preview image (og:image). Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

video.description: The custom link preview video (og:video). Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

rewrite.description: Whether the short link uses link cloaking. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

ios.description: The iOS destination URL for the short link for iOS device targeting.

android.description: The Android destination URL for the short link for Android device targeting.

doIndex.description: Allow search engines to index your short link. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

utm_source.description: The UTM source of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the UTM source in the destination URL.

utm_medium.description: The UTM medium of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the UTM medium in the destination URL.

utm_campaign.description: The UTM campaign of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the UTM campaign in the destination URL.

utm_term.description: The UTM term of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the UTM term in the destination URL.

utm_content.description: The UTM content of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the UTM content in the destination URL.

ref.description: The referral tag of the short link. If set, this will populate or override the `ref` query parameter in the destination URL.

webhookIds.description: An array of webhook IDs to trigger when the link is clicked. These webhooks will receive click event data.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of links for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

schema.description: The domain to filter the links by. E.g. `ac.me`. If not provided, all links for the workspace will be returned.

parameters.name: tagId
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use `tagIds` instead. The tag ID to filter the links by.

schema.description: Deprecated. Use `tagIds` instead. The tag ID to filter the links by.

parameters.name: tagIds
parameters.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

schema.description: The tag IDs to filter the links by.

parameters.name: tagNames
parameters.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

schema.description: The unique name of the tags assigned to the short link (case insensitive).

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The folder ID to filter the links by.

schema.description: The folder ID to filter the links by.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

schema.description: The search term to filter the links by. The search term will be matched against the short link slug and the destination url.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

schema.description: The user ID to filter the links by.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The ID of the tenant that created the link inside your system. If set, will only return links for the specified tenant.

schema.description: The ID of the tenant that created the link inside your system. If set, will only return links for the specified tenant.

parameters.name: showArchived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

schema.description: Whether to include archived links in the response. Defaults to `false` if not provided.

parameters.name: withTags
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. Filter for links that have at least one tag assigned to them.

schema.description: DEPRECATED. Filter for links that have at least one tag assigned to them.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The field to sort the links by. The default is `createdAt`.

schema.description: The field to sort the links by. The default is `createdAt`.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The sort order. The default is `desc`.

schema.description: The sort order. The default is `desc`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. Use `sortBy` instead.

schema.description: DEPRECATED. Use `sortBy` instead.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number for pagination.

schema.description: The page number for pagination.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page.

schema.description: The number of items per page.

parameters.name: tenantId

get.description: Retrieve the info for a link.

schema.description: The domain of the link to retrieve.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the link to retrieve.

parameters.description: This is the ID of the link in the your database.

patch.description: Update a link for the authenticated workspace. If there's no change, returns it as it is.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The id of the link to update. You may use either `linkId` (obtained via `/links/info` endpoint) or `externalId` prefixed with `ext_`.

delete.description: Bulk delete up to 100 links for the authenticated workspace.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of link IDs to delete. Maximum of 100 IDs. Non-existing IDs will be ignored.

post.description: Track a lead for a short link.

clickId.description: The ID of the click in PIMMS. You can read this value from `pimms_id` cookie.

eventName.description: The name of the event to track.

externalId.description: This is the unique identifier for the customer in the client's app. This is used to track the customer's journey.

customerId.description: This is the unique identifier for the customer in the client's app. This is used to track the customer's journey.

customerName.description: Name of the customer in the client's app.

customerEmail.description: Email of the customer in the client's app.

customerAvatar.description: Avatar of the customer in the client's app.

metadata.description: Additional metadata to be stored with the lead event

post.description: Track a sale for a short link.

externalId.description: This is the unique identifier for the customer in the client's app. This is used to track the customer's journey.

customerId.description: This is the unique identifier for the customer in the client's app. This is used to track the customer's journey.

amount.description: The amount of the sale. Should be passed in cents.

paymentProcessor.description: The payment processor via which the sale was made.

eventName.description: The name of the sale event. It can be used to track different types of event for example 'Purchase', 'Upgrade', 'Payment', etc.

invoiceId.description: The invoice ID of the sale.

currency.description: The currency of the sale. Accepts ISO 4217 currency codes.

metadata.description: Additional metadata to be stored with the sale event.

post.description: Create a new embed token for the referral link.

get.description: Retrieve a QR code for a link.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to generate a QR code for.

schema.description: The URL to generate a QR code for.

parameters.name: logo
parameters.description: The logo to include in the QR code. Can only be used with a paid plan on PIMMS.

schema.description: The logo to include in the QR code. Can only be used with a paid plan on PIMMS.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the QR code in pixels. Defaults to `600` if not provided.

schema.description: The size of the QR code in pixels. Defaults to `600` if not provided.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level of error correction to use for the QR code. Defaults to `L` if not provided.

schema.description: The level of error correction to use for the QR code. Defaults to `L` if not provided.

parameters.name: fgColor
parameters.description: The foreground color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#000000` if not provided.

schema.description: The foreground color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#000000` if not provided.

parameters.name: bgColor
parameters.description: The background color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#ffffff` if not provided.

schema.description: The background color of the QR code in hex format. Defaults to `#ffffff` if not provided.

parameters.name: hideLogo
parameters.description: Whether to hide the logo in the QR code. Can only be used with a paid plan on PIMMS.

schema.description: Whether to hide the logo in the QR code. Can only be used with a paid plan on PIMMS.

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: The size of the margin around the QR code. Defaults to 2 if not provided.

schema.description: The size of the margin around the QR code. Defaults to 2 if not provided.

parameters.name: includeMargin
parameters.description: DEPRECATED: Margin is included by default. Use the `margin` prop to customize the margin size.

schema.description: DEPRECATED: Margin is included by default. Use the `margin` prop to customize the margin size.

id.description: The unique ID of the short link.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `pim.ms` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

url.description: The destination URL of the short link.

trackConversion.description: Whether to track conversions for the short link.

externalId.description: The ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in future API requests (must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter). This key is unique across your workspace.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant that created the link inside your system. If set, it can be used to fetch all links for a tenant.

programId.description: The ID of the program the short link is associated with.

partnerId.description: The ID of the partner the short link is associated with.

archived.description: Whether the short link is archived.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the short link will expire in ISO-8601 format.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when the short link has expired.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

proxy.description: Whether the short link uses Custom Social Media Cards feature.

title.description: The title of the short link generated via `api.pimms.io/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

description.description: The description of the short link generated via `api.pimms.io/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

image.description: The image of the short link generated via `api.pimms.io/metatags`. Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

video.description: The custom link preview video (og:video). Will be used for Custom Social Media Cards if `proxy` is true.

rewrite.description: Whether the short link uses link cloaking.

doIndex.description: Whether to allow search engines to index the short link.

ios.description: The iOS destination URL for the short link for iOS device targeting.

android.description: The Android destination URL for the short link for Android device targeting.

geo.description: Geo targeting information for the short link in JSON format `{[COUNTRY]: https://example.com }`.

publicStats.description: Whether the short link's stats are publicly accessible.

tagId.description: The unique ID of the tag assigned to the short link. This field is deprecated – use `tags` instead.

tags.description: The tags assigned to the short link.

folderId.description: The unique ID of the folder assigned to the short link.

webhookIds.description: The IDs of the webhooks that the short link is associated with.

comments.description: The comments for the short link.

shortLink.description: The full URL of the short link, including the https protocol (e.g. `https://pim.ms/try`).

qrCode.description: The full URL of the QR code for the short link (e.g. `https://api.pimms.io/qr?url=https://pim.ms/try`).

utm_source.description: The UTM source of the short link.

utm_medium.description: The UTM medium of the short link.

utm_campaign.description: The UTM campaign of the short link.

utm_term.description: The UTM term of the short link.

utm_content.description: The UTM content of the short link.

userId.description: The user ID of the creator of the short link.

workspaceId.description: The workspace ID of the short link.

clicks.description: The number of clicks on the short link.

lastClicked.description: The date and time when the short link was last clicked.

leads.description: The number of leads the short links has generated.

sales.description: The number of sales the short links has generated.

saleAmount.description: The total dollar amount of sales the short links has generated (in cents).

createdAt.description: The date and time when the short link was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the short link was last updated.

projectId.description: The project ID of the short link. This field is deprecated – use `workspaceId` instead.

id.description: The unique ID of the workspace.

inviteCode.description: The invite code of the workspace.

stripeId.description: The Stripe ID of the workspace.

billingCycleStart.description: The date and time when the billing cycle starts for the workspace.

paymentFailedAt.description: The date and time when the payment failed for the workspace.

stripeConnectId.description: The Stripe Connect ID of the workspace.

usageLimit.description: The usage limit of the workspace.

linksUsage.description: The links usage of the workspace.

linksLimit.description: The links limit of the workspace.

salesUsage.description: The dollar amount of tracked revenue in the current billing cycle (in cents).

salesLimit.description: The limit of tracked revenue in the current billing cycle (in cents).

domainsLimit.description: The domains limit of the workspace.

tagsLimit.description: The tags limit of the workspace.

foldersLimit.description: The folders limit of the workspace.

usersLimit.description: The users limit of the workspace.

aiUsage.description: The AI usage of the workspace.

aiLimit.description: The AI limit of the workspace.

conversionEnabled.description: Whether the workspace has conversion tracking enabled automatically for new links.

dotLinkClaimed.description: Whether the workspace has claimed a free domain.

partnersEnabled.description: Whether the workspace has PIMMS Partners enabled.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the workspace was created.

role.description: The role of the authenticated user in the workspace.

users.description: The role of the authenticated user in the workspace.

primary.description: Whether the domain is the primary domain for the workspace.

flags.description: The feature flags of the workspace, indicating which features are enabled.

store.description: The miscellaneous key-value store of the workspace.

allowedHostnames.description: Specifies hostnames permitted for client-side click tracking.

id.description: The unique ID of the tag.
The unique ID of the folder.

accessLevel.description: The access level of the folder within the workspace.

linkCount.description: The number of links in the folder.

createdAt.description: The date the folder was created.

updatedAt.description: The date the folder was updated.

id.description: The unique identifier of the domain.

primary.description: Whether the domain is the primary domain for the workspace.

placeholder.description: Provide context to your teammates in the link creation modal by showing them an example of a link to be shortened.

expiredUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when a link under this domain has expired.

notFoundUrl.description: The URL to redirect to when a link under this domain doesn't exist.

createdAt.description: The date the domain was created.

updatedAt.description: The date the domain was last updated.

id.description: The ID of the registered domain record.

createdAt.description: The date the domain was created.

link.description: The link that caused the error.

linkGeoTargeting.description: Geo targeting information for the short link in JSON format `{[COUNTRY]: https://example.com }`.

id.description: The unique ID of the short link.

domain.description: The domain of the short link. If not provided, the primary domain for the workspace will be used (or `pim.ms` if the workspace has no domains).

key.description: The short link slug. If not provided, a random 7-character slug will be generated.

externalId.description: The ID of the link in your database. If set, it can be used to identify the link in future API requests (must be prefixed with 'ext_' when passed as a query parameter). This key is unique across your workspace.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant that created the link inside your system. If set, it can be used to fetch all links for a tenant.

programId.description: The ID of the program the short link is associated with.

partnerId.description: The ID of the partner the short link is associated with.

password.description: The password required to access the destination URL of the short link.

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

401.description: Although the HTTP standard specifies "unauthorized", semantically this response means "unauthenticated". That is, the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401 Unauthorized, the client's identity is known to the server.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

409.description: This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

410.description: This response is sent when the requested content has been permanently deleted from server, with no forwarding address.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

422.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time ("rate limiting")

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

code.description: A short code indicating the error code returned.

message.description: A human readable explanation of what went wrong.
message.example: The requested resource was not found.
